name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Correction of the slip of the tongue, it should be the Human Resources and Social Security Bureau

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
"Cultural export"
On August 3, it was reported online that workers at Country Garden's Malaysia project collectively held up Chinese banners to demand their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 1, Hebei. A blogger posted a video saying he wanted to run for the position of secretary or mayor of Wannian County, and proposed a series of policies to win votes after taking office, including clearing out village bandits and bullies, ensuring judicial justice, and eliminating formalism and face-saving projects. The blogger said, "If everything is open and transparent, and we just need to follow the procedures, why make it so complicated when it's obviously a simple matter?"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 3, Shenzhen, Guangdong. A man posted a video saying that volunteers brought green bean soup to workers and took photos before taking it back. "Thanks to these volunteers, who ran all over Shenzhen carrying a few cups of green bean soup."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 3, Fushun, Liaoning. At the Red River Valley Rafting Scenic Area, there were no buses to pick up tourists after their visit, leaving thousands of tourists stranded in the area. Some chose to walk down the mountain and ended up falling to the ground due to heat stroke. A large number of dissatisfied tourists flocked to the ticket office, shouting "refund" to defend their rights and seek justice.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 2, the Unified Market Emergency Supply Command Center was officially unveiled in Beijing.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to news on August 4, the number of marriage registrations in the first half of this year hit a new low, a decrease of 498,000 pairs compared with the same period last year.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 2, economist Huang Yiping mentioned in a recent lecture that if market players continue to talk about tight times, salary cuts, and tax increases, it is impossible for them to become more optimistic about the future.
As of now, NetEase News, Sina Finance, and Gelonghui have all deleted this report.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the afternoon of August 3, a knife attack occurred in a shopping mall in Gaoming, Foshan.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 3, a netizen in Anhui (posting location) posted a video saying that the old man in the video was from Zhouzhuang, Suzhou, and was a veteran of the New Fourth Army. Now the old man is bedridden, and no one in the government cares about him. "Where is the way out for the revolution?" The netizen replied, "I believe the country will help, and we will overcome the difficulties ourselves."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 4, at Shenzhen Longhua Xinghe, property owners protested to protect their rights and demanded to move out, and a large number of police officers were deployed to maintain stability.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 3, Henan. It was reported online that the boss of Chaowei Group’s Xinxiang subsidiary said to someone who was asking for his salary, “You are on probation, I will fire you if I say so. I can kill other people with a knife in Shenzhen! If someone is not good to the company, I will spend 1 million to ruin his reputation! I just want the law to rectify me.”

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 4, the demolition of the urban village in Shijing Street, Baiyun District, Guangzhou forced the villagers of Tan Village to sign and talk, which triggered protests from the villagers.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the night of August 3, the tourists who were still stranded in the Red River Valley Scenic Area smashed the ticket office.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 3, Guangzhou, Guangdong. A banner for the demolition of Baiyuntan Village reads: "Whether the children are concerned about their education or not, the parents' demolition is the key." Netizens responded: "The children have become bargaining chips."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 3, in Poznan, Poland, fans held up a banner that read "Imagine everyone going to fuck communism together"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: The cause was that Polish host Przemek Babiarz criticized John Lennon's song "Imagine" played at the Olympics. He believed that the lyrics of the song contained "longing for communism." Subsequently, Przemek Babiarz was suspended by the Polish National Television, sparking controversy in Polish public opinion.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 3, Huang Yusheng, professor of philosophy at the School of Humanities of Tsinghua University and doctoral supervisor, expressed his views on online certificates and numbers: Chinese-style modernization cannot be "registering all citizens". Our modernization should make citizens more free (freedom of speech and thought) than Western citizens.
If a country always tries to turn its citizens into transparent citizens and pawns that can be positioned at any time, this country cannot become a vibrant and creative country.
Any strict monitoring of citizens runs counter to the direction and goal of modern state construction.
As of the time of posting, the article has been deleted.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: @wngb88104467 If you have nothing to hide, then why did you climb over the wall? Aren't there enough apps in China for you to watch?

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 2, Yuan Haoran, deputy director of the Cycling and Fencing Management Center of the General Administration of Sport of China, expressed his views on the topic of "purple face" of American swimmers, which has been a hot topic recently. He attributed the purple face to the color cast of domestic broadcasting services. Subsequently, Yuan Haoran was questioned by a large number of netizens for favoring the United States and defending the United States, which aroused public anger. Some people also reported it to the National Commission for Discipline Inspection. In the end, Yuan Haoran urgently deleted his Weibo and even closed his account.
